comment.text:
This used to be my spot but they changed up the menu so much that I don't like anymore, and usually the staff is great however I encountered a very rude hostess today who told me her name was RJ, but probably lied because at first she refused to tell me (since she knows she was being rude). 

When I came today the bar was completely empty, however a few years ago I wouldn't even be able to find a seat. This should be an indication that the changes you all are making aren't good.

owner_replies.comment:
Nia, thank you for your previous patronage and kind words for most of our staff. I apologize for any issues you had with any of our team, as well as with the menu. Please reach out
to me so I can hear more details, apologize directly, and see what I can do to have you back to make sure you have an excellent experience. 
I look forward to hearing from you.
Andrew Ahlquist, General Manager
aahlquist@sphospitality.com

comment.text: Last I week I dined with some coworkers and to my disbelief the Spanish octopus dish has remnants  of a rats tail. I wouldn't left a review sooner if I hadn't been so stricken with PTSD from the nightmarish experience.
So cute here. Def a vibe for date night or even just playing the bar alone. I came for brunch with the girls. We enjoyed.

photos.caption: This dessert isn't on the menu  iLuvKandy.com
White Sangria Gk Red or Ros√© Sangria
All tasty Garlic Shrimp** Moroccan Spiced Lamb Skewers potatoes

owner_replies.comment: Candy, thank you for joining us for brunch with the girls. We're happy you enjoyed your visit and hope you'll be back for date night or at the bar on your own!

comment.text: Cool place. Awesome location. The best service. The drinks are amazing! The food was tasty but a little overly salty this past visit.

photos.caption: Crispy Brussels Sprouts (very Salty that day- had to send back) and Moroccan Hot Chicken Bites yummmm
Moroccan Spiced Lamb Skewers, Moroccan Hot Chicken Bites, Grilled Spanish Octopus, and the Crispy Brussels Sprouts

owner_replies.comment: Hi Jessica. Thank you for your review and kind words about our location, service, and drinks. We appreciate your feedback about the food and will be sure to keep an eye on that so it is not an issue. We hope to welcome you back soon for an even better experience.

comment.text: Really love the food and ambience of this place. The seafood paella was very tasty. Their lamb burger for lunch is one of my favorite burgers ever. Loved their fried chicken and hummus appetizers. And overall the service was great.

owner_replies.comment: Garichel, that's fantastic to hear how much you love our Gypsy Spiced Lamb Burger and more! Thank you for your very nice review, and we look forward to serving you again soon so we can thank you in person.

comment.text:
Pulled up for dinner shortly after 7 on a Friday. We didn't have a reservation but was quickly seated outside.  The patio area wasn't packed or booked up as I had assumed it'd be (coming from DC, reservations for any outdoor dining is practically a must).  

Our waiter was Chris. He was pleasant and helpful.

Whenever I see a tapas menu, I'm ready to order half if not most of the menu items.  So imagine my excitement.

We decided on the roasted carrots, brussels, grilled octopus, skirt steak, and the scallops.  

The roasted carrots were served cold to our surprise but was absolutely tasty.  I only took a bite or two since I had my eyes on other plates.

The Brussels were crispy and not overly doused in sauce, my fav.  But they were undercooked, way more firm than Id like.

The grilled octopus was quite amazing.  Nice and thick, we could taste the grilled, smoky flavors.  The roaster potatoes were cooked just right, soft at the center with crispy edges. Highly recommend.

The skirt steak was absolutely one of the top 2 plates that came out.  Each bite was tinder and juicy, with the perfect seasoning.  Also, highly recommend.

The scallops were a 9/10.  I loved them more once I got pass the tomato jam.  The tomato jam overpowers the dish initially and I wasn't a fan of that. Every other component tho? Especially the mash, was a perfect compliment.

To drink, I had 50 shades of purple.  It was fruity but light and perfect for a summer day.  The gin wasn't so forward either which I liked, sometime gin can smack you in the mouth.

To close the meal out we had to order the olive oil cake.  The orange gave each bite a citrus hint.  The toasted almond crumble was a great texture add too.

Would I return? Absolutely.  We snapped a picture of the bar during the walk out, as you can see it was full and busy!

owner_replies.comment: Hi Samone. Thank you for your visit and very nice review. We are happy to see you enjoyed our food, atmosphere and service so much. Next time you come back, be sure you introduce yourself so we can thank you in person! We look forward to serving you again in the near future.

comment.text:
Looking for girls night out place or dates? 
This place is it! 
Gypsy kitchen is one of the best restaurants and has the greatest atmosphere in midtown ATL. 
I've been to a lot of places including restaurants in atl. 
I can say this place is worth every pennies you spend here for night outs or date. 
One downside is: 
Foods are amazing but small portions. 
But overall, Servers were very welcoming and caring.

owner_replies.comment: Rachel, we love hearing that, and we look forward to seeing you on your girl's night out or date nights soon. Thank you!

comment.text: Food felt overly salted and fried; there are significantly stronger tapas options in Atlanta

owner_replies.comment:
Iliana, we greatly appreciate your visit but are sorry to hear you didn't feel your meal was ideal. We rarely hear comments like that, but please accept our apologies if something may have gone wrong. If possible, please email me with more details at tallen@sphospitality.com so I can apologize directly and see what we can do to earn a second visit. Thank you, and we look forward to serving you again soon.
Thomas Allen, General Manager

comment.text:
I loved my time at Gypsy Kitchen--the food and vibes are absolutely impeccable and offer a great introduction to Spanish/Middle Eastern cuisine in an area where that kind of food is lacking.

We came in with a large party and got excellent service. Our meat-and-potatoes crew found plenty to eat, but more adventurous eaters could try things like fresh Manchego. I particularly enjoyed the falafel and the flatbread served with the salads. I also love the presentation--beautiful plating while not being too fancy or fussy for a casual dinner. And as others have mentioned, the outdoor space and view of the streets of Buckhead is amazing.

owner_replies.comment: Hi Maxine. Thank you for your visit and lovely review. It's wonderful to know you and your large party enjoyed your meal so much. We hope you'll be back again soon!

comment.text:
Had dinner at Gypsy Kitchen this past weekend...

Service is really friendly and food came out quickly.

The restaurant is really pretty and it was great to be able to sit outside in nice weather in November!

Food is just okay and most of it is swimming in grease. We had the Patatas Bravas, Brussels sprouts, a salad that came with bread and cucumbers, chicken, and asparagus. The highlight was definitely the asparagus but everything else just wasn't good or authentic in any way unfortunately.

Prices are a bit high for the quantity...we paid about $120 including tip. We definitely wouldn't return.

owner_replies.comment:
Ameena, I genuinely appreciate your compliments on our service and ambiance. However, I am sorry that we did not address any issues you had when you were in. Please message me here or email me at tallen@sphospitality.com so I can apologize directly and see what I can do to earn a second chance to impress you. Thank you.
Thomas Allen, General Manager

comment.text: I sat in the patio area, and the view was so cute! I enjoyed the low lighting. The restaurant ambiance in general was cute for a date night and gave a romantic vibe. I enjoy the skirt steak and chicken croquettes it was absolutely delicious! The potatoes were in need of some salt but they were good as well. Our server was attentive. They do validate your parking deck tickets but if you valet you will have to pay. Valet was $12 which isn't bad for the area. I will definitely be back. They only reason I didn't give this restaurant a 5 star is because the food was good but it's definitely not memorable. I also felt I left the restaurant hungry but we were $130 into the bill. Which is not very affordable.

owner_replies.comment: Hi Kristine. We're happy you joined us and enjoyed your meal on the patio so much. It's great to hear you loved our romantic ambiance and your food, particularly the skirt steak and chicken croquettes. Please know that our prices are based on using the highest-quality ingredients and paying our staff a livable wage. Even so, we are still competitive in cost with other top restaurants in the area. We hope to see you again someday soon. Thank you!

comment.text:
We went here for my birthday yesterday, I chose this restaurant because I've had great experiences before.. but yesterday was something else. The service was mediocre, it took us a while to order our drinks and food. We ordered the steak.... And it wasn't until I swallowed a bite that everyone realized it was rancid. We let the waiter know, who brought the manager... who didn't even apologize! The manager just handed us our bill saying "well was everything else good?" And denied the steak being bad!! (I've had this dish at this restaurant before and loved it...)

I'm now in the bouts of food poisoning. Happy birthday to me...

owner_replies.comment:
Aly, thank you for being a loyal customer and for choosing to celebrate your birthday here with us. We're happy to know you've enjoyed your meals with us in the past, but please accept my apologies for your recent experience. We take food quality and safety very seriously and have never had any similar claims about our steak. However, I'd very much appreciate hearing more from you. Please reach out to me so we can discuss this further. It sounds like we could have handled the situation better on the spot and I'd like to apologize directly and see what we can do for you to make things up to you on a future visit. I hope to have the opportunity to regain your trust. 
Andrew Ahlquist, Managing Partner

comment.text: Most of the tapas were pretty good, but pricey since you're paying for the ambiance and location. The ambiance is nice and there was a live music, which I appreciated. The service was good too and we got our orders taken care of upon arrival. My only issue is that on the menu, there is a dessert item titled "Coconut Milk Malabi" and then the description says that it's an 'israeli milk pudding...' It is actually Palestinian and many Middle Eastern/Arab countries make that dish that existed long before Israel existed (prior to 1948).

owner_replies.comment: Susy, thank you for your visit and compliments. We're so pleased you enjoyed our tapas, atmosphere, and service. Thank you for the input regarding the menu description. We'll see what we can do about that, and we hope to see you back soon!

comment.text: Great atmosphere! Had a cute little table towards the back, but the bar and the outdoor deck area (looked to be closed in and heated at the time) looked like great vibes too!  Our service was acceptable, but that's the best I can say about it.  But the food and drinks, mostly awesome.  We tried the Octopus (def get that) and the fried cheese off the small plates menu, both had great flavors. For my main I had the scallops, they were very good, but not the most melt in your mouth I've ever had. My date had the duck, the bite I had was delicious.  Oh...and I would normally never order a purple drink, but whatever their purple specialty cocktail was came recommended and I was so glad I chose it - I ended up having two!  And the purple wasn't too cheesy lol!  Overall, I totally recommend this place, would love to go back with a group of friends.

owner_replies.comment: Amanda, we appreciate your feedback and are glad to hear that you and your date enjoyed our food, atmosphere, and 50 Shades of Purple cocktail so much. We're sorry to hear that the service was only acceptable, and we will definitely take your comments into consideration to improve in that area. We look forward to welcoming you and your friends back soon. Thank you!

comment.text:
Great Atmosphere! Sit on the patio if the weather is nice! 
Expect to spend some money.

owner_replies.comment: Hi Kris. Thank you so much for this kind five-star review. We're glad to hear you enjoyed our outdoor patio, and we look forward to having you visit us again sometime soon!

comment.text:
Fair service & flavorful tapas in the heart of Buckhead Village. Great for get-togethers and gatherings. 
Things you should know:
I. PARKING
If you park in the Buckhead Village garage, they'll validate your ticket (upon request only) for 3 hours worth of stay. 
II. SERVICE
Unaccommodating waitress on a MONDAY with hiccups in communication with the kitchen ~ someone dropped the ball. We didn't get one of our orders on a day I would consider least hectic for restaurant businesses. It happens though. I can't imagine what it's like on a weekend. 
III. QUALITY 
What gave this place a better rating. The flavors are paired so well. I would recommend specific items on the menu, but they change it fairly often (which is nice). 
IV. CAPACITY 
We had to make a reservation, so I'm assuming they're fairly busy closer to opening times.

photos.caption: Roasted Mushrooms & Whipped Goat Cheese Toast

owner_replies.comment: Chelsea, thank you. It's nice to see you enjoyed our food so much and we greatly appreciate your visit and review. Hopefully, you'll be back soon!

comment.text: I love this place; the service is excellent & the food is fabulous! It's a tapas type of place, so be prepared to order small plates, but everything is ON POINT! I took my Dad here, and he usually doesn't like to share  but has been raving about it ever since. Their lamb chops & octopus are my favorites. The times I've been, it's very high energy, and the ambiance is excellent for small and large groups. I recommend it to all of my friends and family when they are in town!

owner_replies.comment: Beate, thank you for bringing your dad in. We're happy to know you both enjoyed our food and ambiance so much. We truly appreciate your recommending us to your friends, and we look forward to having you back soon!

comment.text:
If you looking to try something new and out of the ordinary, add this place to your list. With options for both indoor and outdoor, booth, table or bar, ..you can't go wrong with the seating. They have the perfect vibe for a large group or a small intimate date night.

Now let's get to the food ! They have a nice variety of small plates, with a smaller selection of large entrees. Amount my brunch group, we tried just about every small plate. Although everyone had dishes they enjoyed, the collective fan favorites were the Skirt Steak and Brussels Sprouts. For my large plate I had the Shwarma Spiced Duck Confit, which was a tad bit dryer than I prefer, but was still very filling.

I personally was not drinking, but there was a large variety on the menu and no complaints at the table once they were finished.
 
Lastly, we had great service from Jimm! He had plenty of food recommendations, and even took our group photo for us!

owner_replies.comment: Hi Kassidy. Thank you for your visit and your nice feedback. We're happy you and your group enjoyed many small plates and that Jimm provided great service. We hope we will see you again someday soon.

comment.text:
Great food & Vibes :)

Definitely recommending octopus and seafood paella for all seafood lovers! It was tad bit salty for my taste, but regardless it was great! Hummus was definitely was right choice to ease down other strong dishes.

It's not on the photo, but recommending 50 Shades of Purple for cocktail! Sweater sides for anyone who wants drink with less alcohol taste  and the color is beautifully presented! 

It was great place to visit with your friends and family.

photos.caption: Seafood Paella, Grilled Spanish Octopus, Chickpea Hummus

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for joining us, Kyeung, and for your kind words and recommendations! We're so glad you enjoyed your food and 50 Shades of Purple cocktail. We hope you join us again soon with friends and family, or a special night with a special someone! We look forward to serving you.

comment.text: I came here with a group of about 10 for a dinner on a Friday. The place was definitely busy but because of the layout it still felt intimate because the tables weren't crammed together. This would definitely be a good date night spot with the mood lighting they have. In keeping with their small tapas theme we ended up ordering multiple plates and sharing them. I tried the tirokroketes - fried goat cheese balls with an almond Romesco sauce and they were delicious. We also got to try three out of four of their desserts (cheesecake, chocolate tart, and tiramisu) and they were all quite good but the cheesecake was the clear winner - excellent. It's Buckhead so the prices felt on par with what you'd pay for any other restaurant in the area. Service was solid. The waitress attending to us was attentive without being intrusive and managed to keep tabs on our table as more people came to join. When she saw someone else joined she would check in and see what they wanted. Overall, I'd definitely recommend checking them out if you're in the area. Good food and good vibes.

photos.caption: Tirokrokettes (likely misspelled). Either way really good.

owner_replies.comment: Hi Chioma. We are happy to see you enjoy our food, service, and vibes so much. Thank you! We look forward to serving you again next date night or anytime in the near future.

comment.text:
Service was fine. Outdoor seating is cozy & a bit romantic. Food gets cool quickly- it's fall. 

Now for the food - not impressed. The only thing that was tasty were the garlic shrimp and lamp chops. We also had their Brussels and potatoes. 

The potatoes were gross

owner_replies.comment:
Tena, thank you for your kind words on our outdoor seating, but I am genuinely sorry to hear that we let you down in other ways during your recent visit. Please contact me at tallen@sphospitality.com, as we'd love the opportunity to serve you again someday for what I'm sure will be an excellent dining experience. I hope to hear from you soon. Thank you,
Thomas Allen, General Manager

comment.text: Gypsy Kitchen owes me nothing. I had such a great experience! Food was so good, we nearly tried every tapas dish. Shoutout to our server, I forgot his name but it was a tall white guy with a man bun! He was so kind and recommended the perfect dishes. Cocktail drinks were so good and refreshing! I would definitely go back, maybe sit outside next time.

owner_replies.comment: Westlyan, thank you for your wonderful comments. We look forward to serving you again soon, either indoors or out!

comment.text:
Meh. I get that the popularity here is centered around its Instagramability. The ambience is definitely nice. The food and service were super mediocre. I ordered the scallops tapas and the mushroom and goat cheese toast. The toast wasn't toasted and the mushrooms were room temp. The scallops were cold and one was so fishy I thought I'd get sick but the dish did have potential based on green garlic potato puree / french curry / tomato jam / turmeric pickled mustard seeds-- all those flavors were great. 

The drinks were pretty good. The overall bill wasn't bad at all. $45 for two small plates and a drink.

All in all, I won't be back. Unless just for drinks. Atlanta has so many other options.

owner_replies.comment:
Natalie, thank you for your compliments on our ambiance and drinks, but we hope we can have another chance to impress you with our food and service. Next time you can join us, please ask for a manager or me so we can see that you have an excellent dining experience in every way. I hope you will join us again soon. 
Thomas Allen, General Manager

comment.text:
I am visiting from New Jersey with my sister and this was the best decision that I could have made. Daisy our waitress was awesome and super sweet. The drinks came at the perfect time and she wasn't overbearing with the service. 
We order the crispy Brussels sprouts (which is to die for), the ga local lettuces salad ( which I loved) and the garlic shrimp ( which I could have dipped on the broth)for dessert I got this awesome s'mores and my sister order a cheesecake that was like a flan. 
Edgar the chief literally served us our first app and was very personable. 
Thank you for the wonderful service and when I come back to visit this will be the place that I'm coming to!!!!!

owner_replies.comment: Hi Shay. We're happy you and your sister joined us and enjoyed your visit so much. We hope you'll be back again someday. Thank you!

comment.text: Great vibes, great food. Whatever you get, add potatoes. The rooftop was also cute with a nice vibe.

owner_replies.comment: Thank you, Kelly. We're so pleased to hear how much you enjoy the rooftop vibes and food. Hopefully, you'll be back soon!

comment.text:
Sooo Gypsy Kitchen was used for our book club meetup which was the perfect spot. We had a huge table in the back area and the decor screamed book club meetup. The artwork was so beautiful and matched well with the atmosphere. Other than that, I wasn't that impressed with the food, nothing stood out. The food wasn't bad, I wouldn't say the food will bring me back but the bar and social scene, yes.

If you like to read our book club discussion was on The Last Mrs. Parrish! Enjoy.

owner_replies.comment: Marion, we are so glad to hear that we provided the perfect environment for your book club meeting. Thank you for coming in, but we are sorry that you did not feel your meal was ideal for you. That certainly is not how we want our guests to experience our restaurant, and we hope we can have a second chance to impress you someday. Next time, please ask for a manager so we can see to it you have a great dining experience.

comment.text: Food was tasty and we liked almost everything. Our favorites are the small plates. Enter was ok and dessert was alright. Def would just order more small plates next time!

photos.caption: Roasted Mushrooms & Whipped Goat Cheese Toast

owner_replies.comment: Thanh, thank you for your visit. Hopefully, we'll have the chance to serve you again soon for more small plates and to help you choose desserts you will love as well!

comment.text:
My friend recommended we try this place out for dinner when I was in town visiting. The decor and ambiance is very chic and sexy even during the day. Most places only get that vibe once the sun sets, but this place just has "it". We didn't wait long for a table, but it did take the server a while to even greet us. We had ample time to review the menu though lol. We shared several of the tapas which were good but not anything truly to write home about. My friend had the red sangria, which she liked. I had the razzi bone which was quite refreshing. I'd come back for after dinner cocktails and conversations, or maybe a happy hour if they had one, but that's it.

Food rating 
Brussels 9/10
Scallops 7/10
Lamb skewers 7/10
Asparagus 7/10
Skirt steak 6/10
Rezzi Bone 9/10

Customer service 7/10

Ambiance 10/10

owner_replies.comment: Stephanie, thank you very much. We're happy to know you enjoyed your experience with us and we hope to see you back again someday in the near future!

comment.text: Oh, where do I start? This Spanish tapas restaurant was a flavor explosion! The branzino was out-of-this-world amazing, perfectly cooked and seasoned. And those patatas bravas? They were a crispy, spicy delight! The service was top-notch, the staff so friendly and attentive. (Rosie, you're awesome!) Honestly, I'm not a food critic, but this place blew me away. If you want a fantastic meal with a warm atmosphere and great service, this is the spot. Don't miss the branzino and definitely try the patatas bravas - you won't be disappointed!

owner_replies.comment: Hi Jonathan. Thank you for your visit and wonderful review! We're happy to know you enjoyed so many items as well as Rosie's service.  We hope to see you back again someday in the near future for another branzino and more!

comment.text: Came here for happy hour and it did not dissapoint. The patatas bravas were amazing at a great price. The happy hour drinks were also so good! Cool atmosphere and great service to go along with it.

owner_replies.comment: Thank you Christian. It's nice to see you enjoyed your happy hour meal and we greatly appreciate your wonderful review. Hopefully, you'll be back to see us again soon!

comment.text: Tonight I ate at Gypsy Kitchen. I usually don't share this type of information publicly, but there's a cockroach infestation in their kitchen and unfortunately also in their main eating area. It's absolutely disgusting. Do not eat here. The service is also terrifying.

A cool place with mediocre food. Portions are small, dishes are unmemorable, and pricing is less than desirable. I get that it's tapas and it's supposed to be small plates... however, there are other places that do tapas where the portions aren't as minuscule. Our table of four started with the rose sangria- that was good and pretty enjoyable. We ordered a few different tapas and they were all just okay which is disappointing for the price. What I do remember is the paella slightly having a weird taste, almost like something had gone bad or just too many flavors together that it has a slight garage taste to it? Unsure how to accurately describe. Service was good and the place itself promotes a fun, young atmosphere. Overall, would come back for a drink during happy hour and maybe one dish as a snack but not more than that.

photos.caption: Sangria Gk Red or Ros√© Sangria

owner_replies.comment:
Michelle, thank you for your compliments on our service and ambiance, but I am genuinely sorry to hear that we let you down during your recent experience. Please contact me directly at tallen@sphospitality.com, as I'd like to see what we can do to earn a second chance to impress you. Thank you for the opportunity. 
Thomas Allen, General Manager

comment.text: I wanted to leave a review because of how poor the communication was for planning an event. We have hosted corporate events with Gypsy Kitchen previously, and it was a breeze, so we opted for them again. Unfortunately, the communication and planning process was so frustrating that we will not be returning. for every 3-4 emails I would send the event manager, I would get 1 response, and she doesn't answer her phone either. Because of the lack of communication on their end, we were charged for items we did not approve of or want. We ended being charged an extra $500 for this event that was not included in the original proposal. I have been trying to communicate with the event manager to fix this and sort it out (and still am currently, two weeks after the event) but have gotten no help or response. Would not recommend going here, especially for an event.

owner_replies.comment:
Lilian, thank you for having previous corporate events with us. We're pleased to know those went smoothly, but we apologize for any issues you had with the most recent event. Please reach out
to me so I can make sure everything gets worked out promptly. Thank you, 
Andrew Ahlquist, General Manager
aahlquist@sphospitality.com

comment.text:
We visited Gypsy Kitchen during lunch and had a wonderful experience. Abbey was super amazing even ensuring that my god daughter had an amazing birthday. Thank you Abbey!
Will definitely be back for the laid back ambiance and cool vibes as well.

owner_replies.comment: Hi Carmen. We're happy you joined us and that you and your goddaughter enjoyed Abby's service so much during your visit. We hope you will be back again soon. Thank you!

comment.text: Great atmosphere, service and food.  We tried so many items and each had its own yummy flare. We will definitely return and bring our friends.

owner_replies.comment: Hi Kathy. We are happy to see you enjoy our atmosphere, service, and food so much. Thank you! We look forward to serving you and your friends in the near future.

comment.text: My daughter took me here for Mother's Day brunch.  We sat outside on the patio, which was wonderful. The service was great. The tapas 4 plates we ordered  ended up being enough.  The lamb was so good i forgot to get a picture. Everything was fresh and delicious.  Complaints to the chef. We will definitely be returning. Do yourself a favor and get valet parking.

photos.caption: Mushrooms and goat cheese on toast

owner_replies.comment: Lorelei, we are so glad to learn your experience was a positive one with your daughter on Mother's Day. We look forward to seeing you again soon! Thank you.

comment.text: This day was my first outing with my friends for the rainy season. The three of us attempted to do this the weekend before but it was pouring rain all day. Love this place and had to come here on the first Wednesday.  Service is great and they como your parking ticket. I haven't ordered many items from the menu, but the charcuterie board never disappoints. It comes with a variety of cheeses, meats and a delicious onion jelly. It's super filling and can feed 2-3 people (as an appetizer) easily.

owner_replies.comment: Hi Alice. Thank you for our rainy season visit! We're happy to hear you enjoy our charcuterie so much, and appreciate your stellar review! We hope to see you again sometime very soon, whether it's raining or the sun is shining!

comment.text: Came in last Thursday with my fianc√© to catch their happy hour. This place has been on my list for a while! It's right in buckhead village. They have happy hour from 4-6 on the weekdays. We arrived at 5:30 and were able to catch it! They have a few tapas and flatbreads to choose from as well as a selection of wine and gin cocktails. We got two tapas and a flatbread as well as two glasses of white wine. The tapas are $4 each. We got the patatas bravas and the chicken croquettes. We also got the chicken flatbread which was $10, although the other flatbreads they offer at happy hour vary in price. It was all great! The potatoes were a bit spicy - or at least the sauce was. The croquettes were delicious! So creamy on the inside. We also loved the flatbread! It had chicken, goat cheese and a balsamic drizzle. It was plenty of food for the two of us! Love the inside of this place too!

owner_replies.comment: Carlie, thank you for your lovely review! We are happy to see you had a great visit with us and that you especially enjoyed our flatbread. We look forward to serving you and your fianc√© again sometime in the near future!

comment.text: ngl the last few times I've come here I didn't like it but this time around was different. This place is a little bit on the pricier end. First glance the menu is best suited for people with acquired tastes. Menu is divided into small plates and large plates. The portions are small. I don't eat a lot so I ended up getting 2 small plates: falafel and the hot chicken bites. Both really good. Service was great, always fast and friendly. We walked in without a reservation and were seated in the outdoor area which is the more popular area to sit (Indoor usually looks empty). The waitress checked on us often. The vibes were great. Super aesthetic. Great for pics. There was a man playing guitar which added to the very loungy/bougie vibe. Overall great spot for appetizers and drinks if rooftop vibes are your thing.

photos.caption: Moroccan Hot Chicken Bites, Chickpea Falafel

owner_replies.comment: We're glad to hear that you had a great meal, Rebecca. Thank you for your kind words. We are pleased to know that you enjoyed your experience with us. We look forward to serving you again in the near future.

comment.text: Food was good! I like the small plates style of ordering. Makes it easy to try multiple meals with more than one person. Drinks were good and they even have a nice rooftop!

photos.caption: Roasted Mushrooms & Whipped Goat Cheese Toast

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for your kind comments, Jordan. We hope to see you back on the rooftop soon!

comment.text:
Let me start by saying the food was delicious, I would not go super hungry it's tapas style and great for happy hour or light eats. I'd give 5 stars.

The initial service was 1 start, the hostess have the worst attitude, not friendly at all and not accommodating. When we finally were able to sit outside on the "open" patio our server was phenomenal. She completely turned the crappy situation around and was so attentive and awesome!

owner_replies.comment: Ashley, thank you for your kind words about our food. We are happy to know you enjoyed every bite and that your server was amazing. Please accept our apologies if you felt like the hostess could've been friendlier. Great customer service is one of our top priorities so we will certainly look into what may have happened and make sure it doesn't happen again. Next time you visit us we'll make sure that everything is perfect from start to finish!

comment.text: The food was good and it came out pretty timely. I sat outside and had a cute view of the shop sidewalks below.

owner_replies.comment: Keona, we're delighted to hear that you enjoyed our food and enjoyed dining outside. We appreciate your support and hope to welcome you back soon for another enjoyable dining experience.

comment.text:
Delicious food and swanky interiors and views! 

Came here Friday night for a girl's night dinner and reunion and honestly don't have anything to complain about. Parking is validated in the large garage underneath the shopping complex for up to 3 hours. The restaurant is located in an upscale area of Buckhead with tons of shops and restaurants. 

We sat inside, but they had the patio doors open so we could see outside. People were dressed from smart casual to business formal and there was a birthday and wedding party in there.

We got the cheese board, brussel sprouts, octopus, patatas bravas, croquetas, and paella.

Cheese board - Good to share amongst 4 gals. They preslice the cheese which saves a lot of mess. Wasn't a big fan of the pickled veggies that come free with it though. They were pretty mushy and not pickled well. The meats and cheeses were great though. We got the manchego and mahon cheese paired with spanish sausage and jamon serrano. It also comes with a tomato jelly, pickled onions, and bread. 

Brussel sprouts - Crispy and light, everyone loved this.

Octopus - Cooked really well -- crispy outside and chewy on the inside. Wasn't a fan of the sauces it comes with though. There's a yogurt sauce, black bean sauce, and tomato sauce. Thought the tomato was the most natural, but the octopus is seasoned just fine without these. The sauces are a bit too strong.

Patatas bravas - I like how they used smaller potatoes and cut them into various sizes so it wasn't just cubes as I've seem at other restaurants. Really crispy. The sauce is also good and a bit more tangy than a typical aeoli. Quite enjoyed this one!

Croquetas - probably my favorite -- perfectly crispy with a creamy inside. I think it came with 5, so more than enough to share. 

Paella - Rice was done well -- this one was a bit more on the soupy side with the sauce, and had peas. Fair amount of shrimp and mussels. 

For dessert, we shared a tres leches cake that was delicious. A lot more cinnamon/berries than I've traditionally had with this cake, so it tasted kind of like the holidays, but it was a chilly night and this was perfect.

Service was great and they came by very often to check on us. Prices were fair, and I would say on the lower-medium side considering the area and other Atlanta tapas restaurants.

Overall, would recommend and would love to come back! Would make a great place to take a date or anyone else you're looking to impress.

photos.caption: cheese board w/jamon serrano, spanish sausage, manchego, and mahon. Also comes with bread, pickled veggies (cauliflower, celery, carrots)

owner_replies.comment: Alicia, thank you. It's nice to see you enjoyed your meal and we greatly appreciate your visit and review. Hopefully you'll be back soon!

comment.text: Gypsy Kitchen is a fun rooftop bar and tapas restaurant tucked away in  the Buckhead Village District.  Great tapas and the cocktails are sophisticated with plenty of variety. Good spot to hang out with friends or a date night.

owner_replies.comment: Kee, thank you very much. It's nice to see you enjoyed your meal and we greatly appreciate your visit and review. Hopefully, you'll be back soon!

comment.text: The food was really great! Went there with a group of friends so I got to try several of the tapas, and they were amazing! Definitely hind end so be ready to spend some bucks! Oh, and it's on a rooftop so the  view is great for pictures too.

owner_replies.comment: Hi Chipo. We are happy to see you and your friends enjoyed our food, service, and rooftop views so much. Thank you! We look forward to serving you again in the near future.

comment.text:
I was in the area so of course I couldn't resist my favorite restaurant. I love coming here because the food here is tapas style and very tasty. Of course I got my favorite garlic shrimp, but today I tried something different on the menu. I tried one of the meat and cheese spread. I'm glad I did ! Im not to familiar with cheese and meat spreads so I asked the opinion of my waiter, and made my decision based off of his recommendations. Next time I'll def try the chefs board. My spread was one of the best spreads I've ever had. The cheese tasted so authentic and fresh. Now to end my review .. Olive Oil Cake. It's so light, refreshing, not too sweet not too tart. I've have olive oil cake at other restaurants and this one is truly the best !! They pair it with an almond crumble if you want to add a little sweetness or the sauce if you want to add a little bit of the tart to your cake.
My waiter Yetee was fantastic! He checked in and was am smiles the entire time. He gave great recommendations and was very knowledgeable of the menu. 
I had planned on visiting Spain pre pandemic, i definitely will seek visiting Spain soon due to the appreciation of this authentic restaurant!

photos.caption: Brunt pieces behind my Grilled Octopus

owner_replies.comment: Hi Ruthy. Thank you for your visit and very nice review. We are happy to see you enjoyed our food and service, and we will be sure to pass along your compliments to Yetee as well. Next time you come back, be sure you introduce yourself so we can thank you in person! We look forward to serving you again in the near future.

comment.text:
Love the food and appetizers. Amazing see ice and drinks.
Never needed to wait to long when shown up for a reservation .

owner_replies.comment: A, we're happy to hear you enjoyed your meal so much. Thank you for your very kind words and we look forward to serving you again soon!

comment.text: We ate here for Valentine's and it was wonderful! We were on the rooftop and it was decorated so lovely for Valentine's Day! The service was excellent and all the food was amazing!

photos.caption: Outside area had a cover because of rain
Cupid's heart and lovers bite - Valentines special drink

owner_replies.comment: Morgan, thank you so much for spending Valentine's Day dinner with us. We are happy you enjoyed your meal and we genuinely appreciate this wonderful review! We look forward to serving you again someday soon.

comment.text:
We had a great experience at Gypsy Kitchen. Our waitress recommended some great dishes. The lamb chops were so good that we ordered more. They had the perfect blend of spices.  They are served on a bean pur√©e which was amazing. Our group also ordered hummus and we loved the pita bread that came alongside. 
For dessert, the olive cake is a must try!
We will definitely return the next time we are in Atlanta.

photos.caption: The Seville Rose. If you like rose flavor and vodka then it's a must try!

owner_replies.comment: Noelia, we're so happy to know you loved our lamb chops, and that your overall experience was wonderful. Thank you for coming in and we hope to serve you again soon!

comment.text: This was a great venue! We were celebrating our first anniversary, and were greeted by fantastic staff, who were attentive, caring, charismatic, and made our experience special. We thought the food was excellent! Our hostess was very attentive and sweet. The manager would tend to our table often and ask how the services are coming along and our server went above and beyond to make our night memorable. Would highly recommend.

owner_replies.comment: Joshua, congratulations on your anniversary! Thank you for choosing to celebrate the occasion with us and for your wonderful review! We're happy to know you enjoyed your evening, and we hope to serve you again someday soon!
